etymology.description: 玉(玉) (yù, "jade") + 元(元) (yuán, "origin") = jade toys (ancient) -> playing, having fun
etymology.interpretation: The character 玩(wán) associates the idea of valuable jade 玉(玉) with 元(元), reflecting the historical use of jade objects in play or as toys, symbolizing amusement or leisure.

examples.chinese: 我们去玩吧(我們去玩吧)。
孩子们在公园玩游戏(孩子們在公園玩遊戲)。
examples.english: The children play games in the park.

examples.chinese: 周末到了(週末到了)，我们全家一起玩(我們全家一起玩)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò dàole, wǒmen quánjiā yīqǐ wán.
examples.english: The weekend has arrived, and our whole family plays together.
